867694691:
[

Senior Strategic Planning Manager

Company Name Australia Post Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Summary

At Australia Post, innovation is at the heart of our transformation.

Overview

At Australia Post, digital innovation is at the heart of our transformation, and we are committed to ensuring our teams of digital specialists are challenged, supported and recognised. Technology is transforming our world and because our customers are at the heart of everything we do, we're changing too. So, we provide an environment that ensures we deliver the best: leading edge technologies; a creative, agile approach; a unique breadth of projects and an unexpectedly dynamic, small team culture that feels more like a start-up than a 208-year old icon.

What's the job involve?

The Strategic Planning Manager - Content, Search & Social (CSS) role is both to define and drive the enterprise’s digital go-to-market activity and ensure that Australia Post provides customers with seamless digital experiences throughout their journey. This includes all stages of the customer journey from awareness, consideration, conversion and engagement to advocacy and customer support.

The Strategic Planning Manager - CSS is responsible for providing strategic digital marketing leadership & direction to a high-performing digital team comprised of 35+ digital marketing channel specialists within CSS, as well as Marketing teams across the enterprise.
  • Set the enterprise, segment and channel direction and strategy for our digital go to market activity, both always on and for campaigns. Lead integrated digital channel planning to drive alignment, efficiency and seamless customer journeys between several key capability areas including content production and marketing, UX content, paid and organic search, affiliate, social media and influencer management.
  • Oversee channel integration across multiple digital platforms and formats to drive a great customer experience, engagement, retention, leads and advocacy.
  • Develop customer insights from owned and 3rd party platforms/channels e.g. Omniture, Google, Facebook, Social Studio etc.
  • Play an active role on the CSS Leadership team and work closely with the Head of Digital - CSS and other CSS and DCI Manager roles (Craft leads and Experience managers) to set priorities and translate vision and strategy into action.
  • Work closely with the Senior Planning Managers, Senior Marketing Managers & Marketing Performance Manager in Segment and Enterprise Marketing & Community teams to set priorities and translate the enterprise marketing strategy into action.
  • Work closely with CSS Managers and central marketing to ensure transparency of digital go to market effectiveness e.g. PIRs, creative evaluation, engagement rates, production & media costs/ROI on activities undertaken by product / channel.
  • Use PIR learnings/analytics to continually improve team outputs and marketing campaign effectiveness
  • Working with Enterprise & segment marketing to manage agency relationships – including retainer and workload planning based on upcoming briefs. Specifically running effective digital agency WIPs and planning/reconciliation/PIR feedback sessions.
  • Responsible for managing overall budget (production & labour) – including monthly forecasting, record of spending & reconciliation, with inputs from other CSS managers.
  • Ensure all programs/campaigns are delivered on time, against budget and continue to be evaluated for effectiveness against agreed criteria including industry benchmarks.


What It's Like To Work Here

For you, it means you’ll do great work, learn from the best and develop a career within a robust and well invested but empowering and creative environment. We all work hard – we’re working on major challenges, after all – but we also recognise that you have a life outside of the office, so we provide flexible conditions that enable you to grow whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

What We're Looking For
  • A background in Digital, Marketing and Communications.
  • Great presentation and communication skills.
  • Highly developed communications skills both written and oral as well as, highly developed strategic, commercial and analytic skills
  • Extensive knowledge of go to market processes in Australia Post or similar organisation.
  • Highly developed knowledge of the global digital ecosystem, digital and digital go to market strategy and business imperatives.
  • Tertiary qualification in Marketing, Communications or Business desirable.
  • A solid understanding and appreciation of digital marketing and user experience
  • Ability to negotiate at a senior level with senior stakeholders e.g. GM level
  • Highly developed ability to negotiate at a senior level on a wide range of issues and subjects.


We See Our Culture Just As Important And Therefore The Candidate Will Have

Technical skills are important, however they are not everything.
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work autonomously
  • Desire to try new things
  • Be friendly and approachable!

We believe a diverse and inclusive workplace brings out the best in our people. We encourage applications from people of all ages, nationalities, cultures and disabilities. A career at Australia Post Group can lead down many paths and we are passionate about offering a supportive, inclusive culture, competitive compensation and flexible working conditions that enable you to develop whilst enjoying genuine work life balance.

To register your interest with our passionate careers team, please click 'Apply Now' and please remember to upload your details and your most recent resume.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Staffing and Recruiting
  • Retail
  • Financial Services

Employment Type

Full-time

  • Business Development
  • Sales

Job description

Our preamble:


Annex Media produces engaging and exciting TV Shows for television broadcast to a nationwide audience. At Annex Media, we tell stories about real people and their passions and broadcast these stories on TV. We put a face to the brand and put their stories on TV. Annex Media provides unique opportunities for brands to be on TV.

A great opportunity now exists for a diligent, hard-working, goals-oriented sales representative to join our growing team at our head office in Melbourne CBD. Hourly base wage and uncapped commissions - OTE up to 100k per year.

The position:

We're looking for someone who has a positive and mature outlook, driven by achieving targets and ideally has a background in sales and marketing with a focus on generating new business. Your role will be to research and contact suitable candidates and inspire them to participate in a television programme.

Your duties will include:

  • Making outbound telephone calls
  • Researching suitable participants for an established TV show
  • Scheduling productions on the calendar
  • Keeping records and maintaining client database
  • Improving client experience
  • Using a KPI system, you will be required to achieve monthly sales targets

What we are looking for

  • Passionate, high energy sales personnel
  • Clear, confident communication
  • Self-motivated, driven for success
  • The ability to think quickly on your feet
  • Not afraid to handle objection
  • The knowledge and experience to pitch high
  • Previous sales experience is a must
  • Thrives in a target driven role
  • IT savvy and must be able to speed type
  • Highly organised and punctual

Sound like you? If you're serious about advancing your career in sales, and enjoying the journey along the way, please forward your written application including a cover letter addressing the 'Key Selection Criteria' and resume by clicking 'APPLY NOW'

Applicants with a sales and marketing background will be highly regarded. We welcome university graduates with relevant sales training and experience.

Administrator / Receptionist

Company Name Xpand Group Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 59 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Who It's With

Xpand is a specialist Digital, Technology, Media, Sales and Marketing Consultancy. We provide strategic talent acquisition services via offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Singapore and Hong King

Our clients include many of the world’s leading corporations, financial institutions, technology vendors, systems integrators/consultancies, digital media companies, advertising agencies and some start-ups too.

What You'll Be Doing

The sky is the limit with this one and its totally up to you however, you’ll need initiative and drive to succeed. Some key responsibilities will certainly include:
  • Office management – you’ll need to be great at multitasking to ensure the office runs smoothly. From dealing with day to day operations to ordering food/drink through to IT set ups
  • Administration – as you can imagine, we have heaps of data and we need someone to ensure that the systems are up to date and info is recorded properly
  • Reception – We have a small reception area that will need to be manned when visitors arrive and phone calls redirected. You’ll be the first person the connections hear so if you’re energetic, professional and friendly keep on reading
  • Project Management – Our Consultants will need adhoc help with small to mid-size projects which can be anything from organising social events to dealing with client queries
  • Support – work closely with our Victorian General Manager to ensure he is delivering to timelines and deadlines


What You’ll Need
  • Similar experience with a positive and proactive approach – this role incorporates so many different roles inc reception, admin, customer service, support so basically, we need an all-rounder!
  • IT Savvy – if you’re familiar with Office and love solving problems then this role could be prefect for you. You may be faced with hardware, software, printing, CRM problems all in one day
  • Project management skills are essential, no day will be the same and you’ll have little time to plan – the positive of this will be you’ll never be bored!
  • Have a passion to succeed. You will have an many opportunities to get involved in the wider business, if you want to wear many hats and find something you are passionate about, you’ll be supported and encouraged to take it by the horns
  • As this is a permanent role, we are looking for people who have full working rights. Unfortunately we cannot have contractors or WHVs on this occasion


Why You'll Want It

I’m looking for a superstar that shines in adversity. The scope of the role is huge along with the opportunity to impact. We have a fantastic & diverse team in Melbourne and we are looking for someone who will fit in culturally which includes: professional, friendly and loves to have fun (who doesn’t like fun?!)

If you think you have what it takes then we want to hear from you.

864962900:
[

UX Designer

Company Name MessageMedia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 61 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Hi there, thanks for reading this. Seeing as you're here now, here's a bit about us. We’re a market leading, highly aspirational business with a very clear purpose. This year we’ll deliver around 1.8Bn, yes Bn, messages for our customers. They’ll leverage our class leading technology to communicate with their customers or staff through a highly ubiquitous channel.


With around 140 staff here, Melbourne is our HQ but we’ve got offices in San Francisco, London, Sydney, Hanoi and Auckland aswell. With more than 26,000 customers, who service over 10M Australians, we're the absolute market leader. That being said, we're undergoing some change; we're transitioning from a Technology led business to a design led Product one. As such our product offering is being redesigned and expanded, meaning high quality UX and design is pivotal to our future success.


We’re looking to talk to UX Designers with a strong product focus, we’re not designing sites or landing pages, but SaaS products centered around business messaging. If you’re someone who loves crafting engaging experiences and simplifying the complex, then you’ll love working with our teams.


Some of the design challenges we face at the consumer end include reimagining the experience within the constraints of a mobile phone screen. It’s tougher than think, but that’s why we need you. We often design for both our customer and the end consumer, so there’s always plenty to think about.


You'll be working within the design team, and also as part of our Product teams. We’re a fully agile environment, with cross functional teams that build, deploy and support their own products.


So we're expecting you to have solid experience across the contemporary UX techniques of user interviewing, research, wireframing and so on, along with competence with the usual design tools such as Balsamiq, OminiGraffle, Axure etc. So please include a Portfolio of your work in your application so we can understand how you do what you do.


Here you get to try stuff, fail fast, iterate and come up with ways to make our customers' lives easier and ensure they love doing business with us via thoughtfully designed products. We're sort of like a startup within an established business, so you get all the benefits of both sides.

We offer some great perks for our team such as flexible work options, regular events, training and development programs, birthday leave, advanced technology stack, breakfast bar, end of trip facilities and more in the pipeline.


Be sure to include your portfolio or a link, and let's talk soon. This is an asap hire for us.

The Company

We are currently looking to recruit a skilled purchasing officer to join a leading Australian Manufacturer. This privately owned business is known for the longevity and long term development of their staff and is looking for someone assist with the continuing growth of their business.

The Role

Reporting to the Purchasing Manager and sitting in the purchasing team your responsibilities will include;

  • Purchase raw material needed for the manufacture of a customised product from across 100 local suppliers, mainly local

Service & Parts Analyst

Company Name Renault Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 108 views

Job description

Renault Australia are now seeking to engage a Service and Parts Analyst to join the Renault Aftersales team. This dual role is responsible for supporting product and service improvements within our business through detailed analysis and identification of issues that impact product and service quality in Renault’s Dealer Network. \xa0This role is also responsible for providing a high level of data and reporting support to assist in parts commercial and logistic activities.

\xa0

This position will report directly to the National Service Manager, with key responsibilities for the following:

  • Provide QVN, QSA, ARC and TGW data and analysis via the Potentiate portal and Harmoni database for all departments.

  • Assist in developing and monitoring actions to improve product and service quality.

  • Obtain and provide product quality and customer research.

  • Monitor network service capacity to ensure customer’s current and future needs are met.

  • Manage the daily reporting operation of the QVN and QSA surveys.

  • Manage the daily operations and data requirements for the ARC survey and represent the brand on the industry ARC committee.

  • Assist the technical department through the application of statistical analysis.

  • Support customer relations data analytics.

  • Ensure warranty, incidentology, IQ and CPS data is of sufficient standard to ensure accurate reporting.

  • Ensure dealer data is of sufficient standard to ensure effective operation of the Potentiate and Nidasu Systems.

  • Manage all upgrade projects and ongoing data integrity for CPS program.

  • Manage all upgrade projects for QVN & QSA (VoC).

  • Support data analysis and reporting for the Alliance warehouse daily operations.

  • Support the maintenance of accurate parts stock levels.

  • Support the management of the warehouse cycle count process.

  • Support the synchronisation of the NAPS (Renault) and Matrix (Warehouse) systems.

  • Support the conclusion of Dealer parts enquires through Dialogys and the IQ system.

  • Support the conclusion of logistics issues for the Dealer Network.

  • Assist the wider Aftersales team in special projects and ad hoc reporting tasks as required.

\xa0

To be considered for this opportunity, you will need:

  • Degree in Engineering/Quality Discipline, Business Analytics, Statistics or a similar field.

  • Applied advanced Microsoft skills, specifically in Excel and PowerPoint essential.

  • Strong analytical skills with the ability to demonstrate clear and logical methodology.

  • Technologically savvy with the ability to learn new systems and processes.

  • Excellent attention to detail and problem solving skills.

  • Exemplary interpersonal and communication skills, and the ability to deliver clear and concise messages to the business and external stakeholders.

  • Strong organisational and time management skills, with ability to perform under pressure and manage multiple deadlines.

  • Enthusiastic and demonstrated initiative.\xa0\xa0

A little about us:

We provide property advertising and media online, via mobile, social media and in magazines, and technology services to the real estate industry.


Domain Group has separated from parent company Fairfax Media and listed on the Australian Stock Exchange as a $2.2 billion company. The business is experiencing rapid growth in digital revenues and investing in all areas to drive future earnings growth. Domain offers a dynamic and innovative culture at the leading edge of digital media in Australia.


A lot about you:


Are you a driven Accounts Officer who is looking to join our growing Finance team on a 6-month contract basis. You will be someone who is eager to learn and who is looking for a new challenge at a great company. In this role, you will help in both Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable and the overall accounting procedures.


Your day to day will look something like this:


  • Weekly/monthly invoicing and reconciliations
  • Reconciling debtor accounts and resolving disputes
  • Daily transaction receipting and bank reconciliation
  • Maintaining debtor relationships \xa0
  • Creating and receipting purchase orders
  • Liaising with external vendors on invoice payment status
  • Cost reporting as required
  • Liaising with the Accounts Payable team on any payment issues
  • Setup of new vendors within accounting systems (JDE and others)
  • Working with the wider finance team to identify and implement business process improvements
  • Assisting with month end reporting and reconciliation procedures
  • Accruals, prepayments and reconciliations
  • Other ad hoc duties to support the team


We would love you to have:


  • 2-3 years experience in General Accounts or Bookkeeping
  • An accounting/Finance qualification is desirable
  • Strong communication and written skills
  • Excellent stakeholder management skills
  • A commitment to continuous improvement and a willingness to learn
  • Intermediate to advanced Excel skills
  • A flexible, adaptable and resilient nature
  • High attention to detail

It would be extra special if you have:


  • Exposure to JD Edwards, MYOB or XERO


Why you will love us:


This role will be based out of our Melbourne office in Southbank where you will be able to enjoy lunchtime yoga classes and a game of table tennis from time to time (just to name a couple of things). If you are looking for a challenging role, with a supportive team to develop and mentor you then look no further. You'll be able to enjoy an array of office benefits as well including health insurance discounts, collaborative office spaces and cool stand-up desks!


So...what happens next?


We will give your application the attention it deserves and you will hear from us either way! If you have the right experience, one of our Recruitment Consultants will give you a call (so make sure you keep your phone handy!) and from there the interviews will commence!


Interested?


Go on then, click apply, we would love to see your application pop up!

*A little note to recruitment agencies:\xa0We have this role covered; there is no need to get in touch :). We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and Domain Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thanks!

Senior WordPress Web Developer

\xa0

GMG Digital (www.gmgdigital.com.au) are seeking a Senior WordPress Web Developer who loves the internet, working with the latest technologies, and enjoys thinking outside the box to deliver the final product. You will become an integral part of our dedicated team working with our creatives and strategists.

Do you have 4+ years’ experience in front-end development including HTML, CSS, JS, open-source platforms and a real desire to work as an integral part of a fast-growing team.

\xa0

You will be working primarily with WordPress and Woocommerce, as well as other Open Source CMS/eCommerce platforms such as Drupal, SilverStripe and Magento. Whether you’re working on a small, medium, or a large scale project, your attention to detail remains the same, ensuring the finished product has been thoroughly tested across multiple mobile devices and browsers, and looks exactly like what our talented designers have created.

\xa0

You can create your own guidelines to ensure this happens and/or coach designers where necessary. We need someone to take an active role in our projects, working autonomously to deliver amazing experiences to the world, regardless of how small or large the project is.

\xa0

- PHP / MYSQL / HTML5 / CSS3 (SCSS or LESS) / JavaScript / jQuery

- High level of time management and deadline focused

- Familiarity with design softwares such as Sketch and Adobe Photoshop

- Familiarity with cPanel, WHM, Git, and BitBucket

\xa0

\xa0

Bonus skills:

- Experience with frameworks such as ReactJS / VueJS

- Experience with RESTful services

- Experience working with other Open Source CMS’s such as SilverStripe and Drupal

- Experience working with Magento

- Experience working with JIRA or Trello

- Experience with Optimizely or VWO

- Understanding or interest in UX principles

- Teach us a thing or two about the latest technologies and how we can improve efficiency

\xa0

\xa0

- What’s On Offer -

\xa0

We are offering the right candidate an attractive package ($70,000 - $80,000) depending on experience. + 15% of your annual salary towards development e.g. research, books, courses, seminars etc.

\xa0

Personal Development:We are always investing in the education of our team, with allowances for learning in a form that best suits you (research, books, courses, seminars etc).

\xa0

Latest Gear:Don't deal with a crappy old PC, we have a brand new Macs for you to work on.

\xa0

Team Bonding:We head to the pub for lunch Fridays and love an afternoon drink.

Company Name Qantas Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 141 views

Job description

Software Engineer (JavaScript)

Booking Platform Team

  • Full Time, permanent opportunity based in our Melbourne offices
  • Be part of a team that values great engineering principles and practices
  • Build amazing things with autonomy, self direction and a healthy work life balance

Qantas Hotels believes that the best creativity comes when a diverse group of people work together to reach a shared objective. We form cross-functional Product Teams, focused on data and employing modern agile and lean practices to maximise customer value.

We are a small Qantas Group company. We operate an accommodation business offering 2.5million hotel and Airbnb listings to Jetstar and Qantas travelers. We enjoy all the support and benefits of being part of one of Australia’s most successful and loved brands, but operate like a small, dynamic digital company. Our purpose is to consistently provide a seamless and rewarding accommodation experience for every Qantas Group traveler.



What we’re looking for...

An enthusiastic JavaScript engineer to join our Bookings team and help out with Booking Manager: a JavaScript application that provides our Customer Support Agents with a simple experience so that they can focus on providing great customer service.

Our Booking Platform is an event-driven, service-oriented platform hosted in AWS. It is mostly written in Ruby but has a sprinkling of Node, primarily in the form of AWS Lambda functions. Our goal is to provide a platform that is resilient, performant and easy to support

As a team we are given the freedom to choose how to best achieve these goals.



You’ll have...

  • A solid understanding in writing JavaScript applications
  • Demonstrable experience developing in one of the following web frameworks (or similar): React, Angular, or Ember
  • Considerable exposure to implementing customer facing web applications
  • Fluency with CSS & HTML
  • Knowledge of browser capabilities and limitations
  • A strong desire for continuous improvement and learning
  • Thoughtful approach to design and implementation; more focus on the why than the how
  • A desire to proactively engage with and solve problems



And maybe even...

  • UX Design and Implementation experience
  • Exposure to Ruby
  • Experience building API's as part of a microservice architecture



We can offer...

  • Great colleagues who care about each other
  • Remote work and work from home friendly
  • Product process designed to be as diverse and creative as possible
  • A culture of experimentation
  • Knowledge sharing practices that are ideal for personal development
  • Emphasis on good engineering principles and practices
  • Personal training budget
  • 10% time to express creativity and try things out
  • Generous staff travel benefit with The Qantas Group and other airlines
  • Discounts on hotel accommodation

Qantas is an equal opportunity employer, so by coming to work for us, you’ll be part of an organisation that encourages diversity, supports charities and environmental initiatives. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, and people of all backgrounds to apply.

If you’re ready to step into a culture that will challenge and excite you, submit an application and let’s explore how we go places together.

Job description

RMIT Online is on the lookout for industry Mentors for its online short courses on Developing AI Strategy!

\xa0

Is artificial intelligence your thing? Looking to impart your knowledge to our short course students, sharing your experience and expertise to help them successfully navigate the world of work? If so, read on!

\xa0

Not your average university – who is RMIT Online?\xa0

\xa0

RMIT Online, a subsidiary of RMIT University is an exciting ‘startup’ team dedicated to building a “Community of lifelong learners, successfully navigating the world of work”. We’re small, nimble, fast-paced and working on really exciting futuristic things.

\xa0

We were created to leverage disruptive innovation in the higher education sector in key local and international markets. With student experience at the forefront of our design, we strive to build world-class online learning experiences with our leading industry partners. And we have a bit of fun along the way.

\xa0

Sounds Good! What’s the role?

\xa0

A Mentor is an industry professional who is assigned to 20–30 online students, supporting their learning primarily via video conference and instant messaging. You would be employed on a casual basis for approximately 25-35 hours (TBC) in total, spread over 9 weeks. \xa0There will be opportunities to continue mentoring future courses for successful candidates.

\xa0

As a Mentor, you will be responsible for supporting online students to successfully achieve course competency outcomes. You will use your industry knowledge and skills to facilitate learning and student success by guiding, motivating and engaging students through appropriate mentoring approaches. You may also provide career advice based on the students’ course and career goals.

\xa0

This is a paid position and in addition to your hourly rate, you will have the opportunity to share your passion and build your professional network with those interested in getting into the industry. You will also develop your coaching and leadership skills as you guide students through their learning journey.

\xa0

Let’s talk about you

\xa0

Collaborative, engaging, approachable…are just a few words that describe you well.

With outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, you have the ability to take what you already know and present it to students in a clear manner to facilitate their learning. Specifically, we’re looking out for someone who:

\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0

\xa0

  • Is working with AI technology, in a consultation/strategy or technical manner
  • Is working with areas of the AI stack; Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Robotics, Natural language processing, Automation
  • Has an understanding of how to formulate AI business plans/strategy
  • Is involved in bringing AI product of company to market


  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to drive and support learning engagement and interaction
  • Ability to engage and navigate communication and learning technologies (e.g. Learning Management Systems, Slack, etc.)
  • Previous experience in mentoring or teaching desirable

\xa0

\xa0

Ticking your boxes?


If this sounds like the role for you hit Apply Now or email hayden.brandford@rmitonline.edu.au with a copy of your CV and a cover letter.


Please note that due to the expected high number of applicants we may not be able to reply to everybody. This is an ongoing opportunity so your application will be kept on record for future runs of the course.


RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community

\xa0

Marketing Officer

Company Name Indigenous Business Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 66 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

IBA Level 5 (Salary range $86,365-95,753)


Brisbane, Melbourne, Canberra or Sydney (Darwin considered)

\xa0\xa0

ROLE

The role of the Marketing Officer will be responsible for working with business units across IBA to develop and manage marketing and communications strategies to promote our products and services. This will include the development of marketing strategies to help increase customer engagement, promote products and services, workshops, events and customer success stories among other things.

This role will be a key part of the Communications & Digital team and will fill a crucial role for our internal and external customers.


DUTIES

• Work with internal business units to develop marketing strategies to help promote IBA’s products and services.
• Manage digital campaigns and drive growth across all social media platforms relating to products and markets
• Mange website content, ensuring it is up to date, connects with customers and promotes IBA products and services.
• Write quality content for EDM's, newsletters, social, publications, reports and others.
• Help to develop marketing resources that can be used internally to help customers understand our products and services, but also our processes.
• Work closely with the IBA Communications & Media Manager to identify and manage all media opportunities
• Working closely with IBA’s Graphic Designer to develop publications, tools and resources for customers.
• Develop case studies (written and video) to promote IBA’s customers, products and services.
• Develop, administer and analyse effective social media marketing campaigns, including providing reports and recommendations for continuous improvement.


REQUIRED CAPABILITIES (Selection Criteria):

These are essential unless otherwise indicated.

• Strong understanding and respect of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander culture
• Strong understanding of IBA products and services
• Strong strategic marketing skills
• Sound knowledge of digital marketing and social media tools
• Strong time management skills
• Strong written and oral communication skills
• Ability to adhere to deadlines
• Ability to think creatively and come up with new ideas
• Ability to work independently and cohesively others
• Sound computer skills

Skills required:
• Proven experience in developing strategic marketing strategies and reporting on the results
• Strong background in social, digital and direct response marketing
• Strong communication skills, including writing, presentation and oral with an eye for detail.
• Strong project management, procurement and budget management skills
• Good problem-solving ability, including metrics-driven thinking.
• Previous experience with internal and external stakeholder management.
• Events experience is not mandatory, but a desirable skill as there may be events management required from time to time.
• Experience in managing photography and filming projects is not mandatory but desirable.
• Confidence with digital tools such as WordPress, Campaign Monitor, HootSuite, social media platforms etc.
• While this role can be based in Brisbane, Melbourne, Canberra or Sydney, candidate will be required to travel intermittently.


About you:
• You have a genuine passion and interest in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander affairs. While experience in this space is not mandatory, it is highly desirable.
• Great team player can to work independently and has strong initiative and self-motivation.
• Creative thinker with good problem-solving skills.
• Always happy to assist others.


To apply, go to\xa0http://www.iba.gov.au/careers/current-vacancies/9032-marketingofficer/

Applications close 30 September 2018


Further Enquiries Contact\xa0

Jennifer Tucker\xa0 on 03 9220 6018 or email: jennifer.tucker@iba.gov.au
